banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: When will I get my water next?
videoData.socialTitle: When will I get my water next?

nodes.whoTheyAre: A former civil engineering student, Anu Sridharan is passionate about improving access and health for communities in urban India. She is the cofounder of "Next Drop," a service that sends text message alerts to at least 75,000 residents in Hubli-Dharwad, India to notify them with the date and time a fresh supply of water is due to be piped to their area.

videoData.description: Three billion people in the world don't have access to a consistent water supply, due to issues not limited to infrastructure, supply or mismanagement -- and for some, water may flow every two days or even ten. Sustainability engineer Anu Sridharan launched an organization in India that wants to fix this using cellphones and the power of crowdsourcing information.
videoData.socialDescription: Three billion people in the world don't have access to a consistent water supply, due to issues not limited to infrastructure, supply or mismanagement -- and for some, water may flow every two days or even ten. Sustainability engineer Anu Sridharan launched an organization in India that wants to fix this using cellphones and the power of crowdsourcing information.
